Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Lily Brewer
Reviews.Content: I just bought this as part of a tracfone bundle that came with double minutes for life.  Thus far, I like it pretty well.  It uses CDMA (that's the Verizon etc. network, rather than AT&T;) and the reception is comparable to that of my old Verizon phone in the same areas. I live in a rural part of Maine, so reception is paramount and it truly matters which carrier you choose.  For my own cell phone use habits, this phone pretty much has everything I need as I don't browse the internet on my phone and have an ipod if want download apps. (This phone is not capable of using apps).  The only deficiency this phone has that really bothers me is that there is no micro SD slot, so if you want to transfer data directly to your computer that way, you're out of luck. I just spent an hour searching LG forums and their site hoping this was some kind of mistake, but it doesn't look like it is. I'm not sure how this will work for pictures yet.  However, I was able to send the contact list from my old phone to this one via Bluetooth, so all is not lost.Lastly, if you are particular about this kind of thing, you'll probably want a case for this one, it seems like it will scratch easily. So here it is, a list of the pros and cons.Pros:It's afordableGood reception in this rural Maine and rural New Hampshire.Slick look and easy interface.Bright screenThe camera is comparable to the 1.3 megapixel camera on my old phoneIt's pretty lightweight for its sizeQwerty keyboardMinutes and airtime are conveniently displayed so I'm never left guessingDouble minutes for life, which is a necessityCons:No microSD card.  Bluetooth works for contact list transfer, but I'm not sure about other data yet or if you can transfer it via USB.No idea how much internal memory the phone hasAccording to the tracfone TOS, if you don't keep your service active, you will lose your phone number, so you must add airtime BEFORE it runs out.  It can be reactivated at any time, but they will assign you a new number.

Reviews.Title: Pretty decent, actually
Reviews.Author: S. B.
Reviews.Content: This phone is in some ways much nicer than my previous non-keyboard phones.Pro:1. keyboard is much nicer than endless repetitive button pressing only to go too far and have to cycle through the extended character set all over again. Keyboard is small but with the right technique it can be mastered by most.2. better speaker phone audio than many3. has bluetooth- of course most do now.4. adequate battery life. For me at least.5. CDMA- can access Verizon networks even though mine is a Tracfone- essential for coverage in some areas.6. price is right!Cons:1. no external memory. But internal memory seems pretty adequate.2. no MP3 player. But I want a phone not a toy, so not really a complaint.3. poor camera. But better than no camera I suppose. Hardly a deal breaker for someone needing a cheap basic phone.Bottom line: This is a really decent cheap basic CDMA text friendly phone which works fine even in outlying areas. Perfect phone for me- I am quite happy with it. BTW- the gel covers here on Amazon which might be labeled for LG UN200 Saber are a PERFECT fit.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD CDMA PHONE
Reviews.Author: B.Bob
Reviews.Content: Quality and easy to use phone and camera.  Very comparable to the LG500g GSM but wider reception area via Verizon.  Both phones have less battery life than the LG290c and the 290c seems to be more sensitive thus better reception in remote areas.  I find this phone easier to use for text messages with a full keyboard than the 290c.  If you need a CDMA phone and want a full keyboard, I would very much recommend this phone.Update July 18, 2012 - I have used this phone in many locations since I purchased it.  It does a very good job on the Verizon network, much better than my similar 500g GSM phone.  I also used the camera on an accident investigation and the pictures were very useful...only wish you could directly down load them or put them on a memory card.  I have no negatives to report and have found the keyboard easy to use with my "fat" fingers.  For a basic + phone, I highly recommend and well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: This is an older model with few bells and whistles, but for basic communication needs, it gets the job done.
Reviews.Author: Janice Copeland
Reviews.Content: I bought this model because I knew it would get good reception in my rural area, as opposed to some others I've had. I find it very serviceable.

Reviews.Title: yea tracfone
Reviews.Author: REGINA BILLOTTE
Reviews.Content: gets better reception them most other phones. easy to use. hubby learned to text on this phone so that says alot

Reviews.Title: LG 501C
Reviews.Author: bubbastar
Reviews.Content: Love my phone..buttons could be bigger for my fingers tho!Easy to use and sound quality good.Set up was also a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Does not work in my zip code area
Reviews.Author: ladydragon
Reviews.Content: The phone is okay, not a problem. Problem is that this particular phone does not work in my Zip Code at all. So, check to be sure that this phone works in your zip code. I received a replacement tracfone, so it will work in my zip code. So far, so good.

Reviews.Title: perfect phone
Reviews.Author: buschlead
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this phone, the features are perfect for the way I sue the phone.  I am saving over $400.00 a year by switching to TRACFONE

Reviews.Title: Great cell phone
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic cell phone, nothing else compares to older models I've had in the past. Due to my profound deafness and cannot hear on the phone and use this primarily for text messages, Easy to use keyboard has been a great convenience for me & keeps me in close contacts with good friends!

Reviews.Title: It's and OK Phone, if you need just a basic phone without a Sim Card
Reviews.Author: burt reed
Reviews.Content: The one thing I really don't like about this phone is that you are limited to 160 characters per text. It deducts .30 mins from you time when you text 160 characters or less. I bet you didn't realize that 160 characters if @ 2 1/2 sentences....not a lot of verbage.

Reviews.Title: Great LG 501C prepaid phone
Reviews.Author: Cathy long
Reviews.Content: I've had my Tracfone LG 501C for a year now and this one is the best one I've ever had! Great reception most everywhere. The text messaging has always worked everywhere! Camera takes excellent pictures! Love mine! Excellent buy and choice!

Reviews.Title: Works and inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Vincent Miller
Reviews.Content: Purchased for our jr. high daughter so she could keep in touch with us.I see know way to get voice, text and web access cheaper ... must admit she rarely uses it ... but that is fine when we are not spending much for it.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother, get something better
Reviews.Author: rndmnmbr
Reviews.Content: There is no way to transfer data to and from the phone that does not cost airtime.  Both bluetooth and USB are locked down and won't let you transfer files.  If I had known I'd have to waste airtime just to get data on and off the phone, I'd have left it to gather dust on the shelf at the store.  Don't waste your time, go buy a better phone.
